events.name: 3D Printing Excellence with CATIA V5
events.description:
Learn how to 3D design an mechanical component using CATIA Advanced Surface capabilities. Learn from the live demonstration how you can apply advanced techniques to create high quality, aesthetically pleasing and geometrically accurate Surface 3D CAD data. 
Be intrigued on how 3D printing can improve and enhance your business workflow both in time compression and cost savings, and understand how you can translate a concept into a physical prototype within hours. 
Gain insights from experienced professionals on the latest in 3D printing application and various post-process methods in converting your prototype for actual end-use.  
Agenda 





Start 


End

This seminar is catered towards engineers, designers and business owners of all levels in the Aerospace as well as Precision Engineering industry. Join us at this exclusive event and uncover the different applications of 3D printing for you. 
Speakers 
  




  
Stanley Leung 
Pre-Sales & Application Manager 
Stratasys Singapore Pte Ltd 
  


Stanley Leung is the Pre-sales & Application Manager of South Asia, responsible for the technical sales support across the region of South East Asia, Australia and India to ensure sustainable implementation of 3D printing to the field. 
Prior to joining Stratasys, Stanley worked for a distributor under Objet AP Ltd. as a project executive, which owns various 3D printers including SLS, SLA, Objet, Zcorp and MLS in a period of 1.5 years. This is the start of his printing career. 
Stanley joined Objet AP Ltd. in 2011 and assumed the position of a Pre-Sales & Application Engineer for regions of Korea, Taiwan & Japan.  With vast experience on prospect visiting, 3d printing solution consultation and new application implement to the fields, Stanley developed a high-level of expertise and know-how with all that is related to company’s products and in-depth understanding on benefit of implementing  3D printing solution to industries. 
After the merger of Stratasys & Objet in December 2012, Stanley has played an important role in conducting numerous product & application training sessions to new partners. His contribution to strengthen penetration of 3D printing in the field had been recognized by the company and was assigned to be the Pre-sales Manager of South Asia in May 2014. 
Stanley holds a Bachelor Degree in Material Engineering from the Hong Kong City University. 
  




  
Sean Looi 
General Manager 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 
  


Sean Looi is the General Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, the authorised distributor of Stratasys™ 3D printing systems and materials in Singapore, Vietnam and Indonesia. Creatz3D’s additive manufacturing solutions also includes Arcam™ for production of metal components as well as Materialise™ Rapid Prototyping Softwares. 
Despite majoring in MSc Finance, Sean’s passion in 3D printing opened the door of opportunity of distributing 3D printing technologies in 2007. His knowledge in various manufacturing practices placed him in favourable position to advice on advanced solutions for direct digital manufacturing. 
Sean’s accumulated technical experience with a variety of different 3D printing machines, technologies and applications, across all industry sectors, helped him to gain foresights into the macro economy of additive manufacturing potential. 
In return, Sean has been actively helping companies various sectors think more critically, innovate better to improve workflow and is highly respected in the local Additive Manufacturing committee. With over 6 years of experience in the industry, Sean is a regular invited keynote speaker in various local institutions and events. 
  




  
Sally Chuen 
Sales Manager, Singapore 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 


 Sally Chuen is the Sales Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, an authorized distributor of Stratasys products in Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from the University of South Australia, as well as a background education in Chemical Process Technology. 
Sally’s 9 years of past sales experiences revolves around the distribution of equipment in the production and manufacturing industries. She further diversified her portfolio into various other industries following her inception into Creatz3D in 2012 to promote the adoption of Objet 3D Printers.   
In 2013, Sally took the company forward by driving the demand and adoption of additive manufacturing in Singapore. With her background and understanding of the market, Sally currently heads her sales team to advocate the applications of 3D Printing. 
Sally has vast knowledge in 3D printing technologies and their various applications, and she is no stranger to sharing her advices with audiences. 




  
Donald Koh 
Sales Director/Consultant 
TecMaven Group Pte Ltd 


Donald Koh is the Sales Director/Consultant with TecMaven Group Pte Ltd and has over 20 years of Technical Sales experience/knowledge across different Mechanical and Manufacturing software solutions.   
Previously a Mechanical/ Manufacturing Engineer, Donald has helped many companies across different industries with individual Mechanical and Manufacturing requirement. 
Together with Keith Tan, Senior Application Engineer with 14 years of CATIA experience at Tecmaven Group, they will be presenting the power of CATIA V5 Mechanical and Surface Design solution and as well as downstream application to 3D Printing. 




  
Who Should Attend 

3D CAD/CAM Designers
Automotive Engineers
Mechanical Engineers
Business Owners and Decision Makers

Terms and Conditions 

Online registration is required.
Each participant is allowed to order one (1) ticket only.
Registration closes on 3rd February 2015, or when seats are filled.
Organizers reserve the right to the final decision regarding all registration matters

Further information, contact Nigel at 9388 0512 to find out more. 
Alternatively, you can email info@creatz3d.com to inquire.

events.name: Creative Coding Meetup #4 - VJing & Creative Coding
events.description: Happy new year to all! Sorry for almost forgetting to hold a meetup this month, but we'll have exciting items for our upcoming one! We will also be holding our meetup at a new Zopim / Zendesk office! (Please check the address!) The plan for this meetup session is as follows: - Talk: "VJing" by Nozomu Miura - Intermission + InBits - Creative coding challenge break out session In the first talk, Nozomu Miura will be speaking about "VJing and creative coding". Nozomu is a Japanese software developer as well as a VJ working in Singapore. He also runs a company call http://techlife.sg/ He has written many software and it would be really interesting to know about stuff and applications he do. The second talk is still open for now, so feel free to come forward if you have anything to share. Finally we'll end with a creative coding challenge. I'll announce a challenge (which is to be decided) and we'll break out into groups trying to code that. At the end of the session, we'll present our works to other groups. So please bring your laptops if you would like to get your hands dirty. As always, remember to RSVP to estimate the amount of refreshments needed and hope to see you there!
events.location: 401 Commonwealth Drive, Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01, Singapore
